Eric wrote:
> I just went to recover from a checkpoint (all in 1.8) and got the
> following error.  Not sure why this happened...there's no errors in
> the log where this checkpoint was built.  
There is a 'valid' checkpoint file in the checkpoint directory?

> Since this checkpoint is a
> recover of a recover of a recover, I can't just use the recovery log
> unless I went and concatenated all of them together (right?).  
Yes.

> Any
> other ideas on how I might recover from this situation?  The only
> thing I can think of is to recover from one of my older checkpoints,
> then write some JMX or code to run through the current recovery log
> and delete those from the frontier / mark them seen.
>   
I haven't tried what you propose but it sounds like it should work.  The 
JMX importURIs can take as input a recovery log so you shouldn't have to 
write code -- or what are you thinking? I don't follow why you need to 
mark recovery items as 'seen'.  On checkpoint, we rotate off the log so 
can you just importUris from the recovery since last checkpoint?

> 09/26/2006 18:02:40 +0000 SEVERE org.archive.crawler.framework.CrawlController initialize On crawl: amazon_reviews_top100_then_all Unable to setup bdb environment.
> java.lang.ClassCastException: com.sleepycat.je.tree.LN incompatible with com.sleepycat.je.tree.FileSummaryLN
>   

For sure you are not recovering a checkpoint written with another 
version of Heritrix (and bdbje)?
